deproj_vol()[source]¶

Calculate the deprojected volume matrix for spherical shells.

This method performs a deprojection of volumes for given inner (radin) and outer (radot) radii, adjusting for any discrepancies between adjacent radii and ensuring consistent volume calculations for each shell.

Returns:

A matrix where each element [i, j] represents the deprojected volume of the j-th shell inside the i-th ring.

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

Notes

  • The method first checks for discrepancies between adjacent radii and fixes them if necessary.

  • A warning is printed if the discrepancies exceed a 0.1% threshold.

  • The volume matrix is then computed using the provided inner and outer radii.

Raises:

SystemExit – If any computed volume element is negative, the program will exit.
